description: A comprehensive analysis blueprint for medical imaging including X-rays, MRI, CT scans, ultrasounds, and other diagnostic images to extract clinical findings, measurements, and diagnostic insights.

image_type.instruction: What type of medical image is this? (X-ray, MRI, CT, ultrasound, etc.)

body_part.instruction: What body part is being imaged?

anatomical_view.instruction: What anatomical view or projection is shown? (AP, lateral, oblique, etc.)

findings.instruction: What are the medical findings and observations from this image?

abnormalities.instruction: List any abnormalities or pathological findings detected in the image

measurements.instruction: Any measurements taken from the image with values and units

patient_identifier.instruction: Extract any patient identifier visible on the image

image_date.instruction: When was this image taken? (YYYY-MM-DD format)

image_time.instruction: What time was this image taken?

imaging_facility.instruction: What is the name of the imaging facility or hospital?

technician_name.instruction: What is the name of the imaging technician?

image_quality.instruction: How would you assess the image quality? (excellent, good, fair, poor)

contrast_used.instruction: Was contrast agent used for this image?

impression.instruction: What is the radiologist's impression or clinical conclusion?

document_type.instruction: Classify this document as one of: medical-history, exam-results, medical-images, identification, other. For medical images, consider: diagnostic images (X-rays, MRI, CT, ultrasound) should be 'medical-images'. Image reports or radiology reports should be 'exam-results'. Patient history documents should be 'medical-history'. Identity documents should be 'identification'. All other documents should be 'other'.

classification_confidence.instruction: Provide confidence score (0-100) for the document type classification. Consider image quality, presence of medical imaging markers, DICOM metadata, and clarity of medical imaging content.
